knowledge_entries.title: An acid-etched low-Pt high-entropy alloy with significantly boosted activity for alkaline hydrogen evolution
key_findings: [1. Acid etching of a PtNiCoFeCu high-entropy alloy creates a nanoporous surface rich in Pt, significantly enhancing its catalytic activity for hydrogen evolution reaction (HER). 2. The etched alloy exhibits superior HER performance in alkaline media compared to commercial Pt/C, requiring a lower overpotential and showing a higher current density. 3. This method offers a promising strategy for developing high-performance and cost-effective electrocatalysts for hydrogen production.]

key_findings: [Ni addition improves hydrogen storage capacity compared to TiVZrNb, C14 Laves phase and BCC main phase have synergistic effect on hydrogen storage.]

knowledge_entries.title: Hydrogen storage of high entropy alloy NbTiVZr and its effect on mechanical properties: A first-principles study
key_findings: [1. Hydrogen absorption in NbTiVZr HEA is energetically favorable and can reach up to NbTiVZrH7. 2. Hydrogen significantly affects the mechanical properties of the alloy, causing reduced ductility and increased brittleness. 3. First-principles calculations provide insights into hydrogen storage behavior and its impact on structural and mechanical properties.]

knowledge_entries.title: Hydrogen induced cracking behavior of the dual-phase Co<ce:inf loc=post>30</ce:inf>Cr<ce:inf loc=post>10</ce:inf>Fe<ce:inf loc=post>10</ce:inf>Al<ce:inf loc=post>18</ce:inf>Ni<ce:inf loc=post>30</ce:inf>Mo<ce:inf loc=post>2</ce:inf> eutectic high entropy alloy
key_findings: [1. The Co30Cr10Fe10Al18Ni30Mo2 eutectic high entropy alloy exhibits a dual-phase microstructure consisting of an FCC matrix and a lamellar B2 phase. 2. Hydrogen charging leads to intergranular cracking along the FCC/B2 phase boundaries. 3. The cracking susceptibility is attributed to the weaker bonding strength and higher hydrogen diffusivity along the phase boundaries.]

Formation of the C14 Laves phase within the BCC matrix improves the hydrogen absorption/desorption kinetics.]

knowledge_entries.title: The role of precipitation in hydrogen diffusivity and mechanical properties of a high entropy alloy
key_findings: [1. Hydrogen absorption induces precipitation of a hydride phase in the TiVNbTa alloy. 2. This precipitation significantly reduces hydrogen diffusivity but enhances mechanical properties like hardness and yield strength. 3. The precipitation process and its impact on properties are strongly dependent on the microstructure of the alloy.]

knowledge_entries.title: Enhanced photocatalytic hydrogen production and simultaneous benzyl alcohol oxidation by modulating the Schottky barrier with nano high-entropy alloys
key_findings: [Nano high-entropy alloys (HEAs) enhance photocatalytic H2 production and benzyl alcohol oxidation.  Modulating the Schottky barrier between HEAs and g-C3N4 improves charge separation efficiency. AlCrFeCoNi HEA exhibits the best performance due to optimized Schottky barrier and synergistic effects among constituent elements.]

knowledge_entries.title: Stretchable high-entropy alloy nanoflowers enable enhanced alkaline hydrogen evolution catalysis
key_findings: [1. Stretchable high-entropy alloy (HEA) nanoflowers were synthesized exhibiting excellent catalytic activity for hydrogen evolution reaction (HER). 2. Dealloying AlCrFeNi HEA ribbons creates a unique nanoflower morphology with interconnected nanosheets, improving active site exposure. 3. The Pt-decorated HEA nanoflowers demonstrate superior HER performance compared to commercial Pt/C in alkaline media.]

knowledge_entries.title: First-principles studies of behavior of hydrogen and mechanical properties of TiCrTaV high-entropy alloys
key_findings: [1. Hydrogen prefers to occupy tetrahedral interstitial sites in TiCrTaV. 2. Alloying with W or Mo increases the stability of H in the alloy and enhances the resistance to hydrogen embrittlement. 3. Hydrogen absorption reduces ductility and increases brittleness in TiCrTaV, but W or Mo additions mitigate this effect.]

knowledge_entries.title: Effects of laser powder bed fusion process parameters on microstructure and hydrogen embrittlement of high-entropy alloy
key_findings: [1. Laser powder bed fusion process parameters influence the microstructure (grain size, texture, porosity) of CoCrFeMnNi HEA. 2. Microstructure affects the hydrogen embrittlement susceptibility of the HEA. 3. Higher laser power and slower scanning speed result in coarser grains and increased susceptibility to hydrogen embrittlement.]

knowledge_entries.title: Development of Ti-V-Nb-Cr-Mn high entropy alloys for hydrogen storage
key_findings: [1. TiVNbCrMn HEA exhibits a reversible hydrogen storage capacity of 1.8 wt% at room temperature. 2. Reducing the content of each element (Ti, V, Nb, Cr or Mn) by half in the equiatomic TiVNbCrMn alloy reduces hydrogen capacity. 3. Hydrogen absorption/desorption cycling exhibits little hysteresis and sloping plateau pressures suggesting a solid solution mechanism.]

knowledge_entries.title: Hydrogen isotope exchange experiments in high entropy alloy WMoTaNbV
key_findings: [1. WMoTaNbV exhibits significant hydrogen isotope exchange, suggesting potential for hydrogen storage or isotope separation applications. 2.
